remarks: Value of a component of the curry functor natural transformation. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Jan-2017.)
statement:
curf2.g $e |- G = ( <. C , D >. curryF F ) $.
curf2.a $e |- A = ( Base ` C ) $.
curf2.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
curf2.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Cat ) $.
curf2.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( ( C Xc. D ) Func E ) ) $.
curf2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` D ) $.
curf2.h $e |- H = ( Hom ` C ) $.
curf2.i $e |- I = ( Id ` D ) $.
curf2.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. A ) $.
curf2.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. A ) $.
curf2.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. ( X H Y ) ) $.
curf2.l $e |- L = ( ( X ( 2nd ` G ) Y ) ` K ) $.
curf2.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. B ) $.
curf2val $p |- ( ph -> ( L ` Z ) = ( K ( <. X , Z >. ( 2nd ` F ) <. Y , Z >. ) ( I ` Z ) ) ) $.
